DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure BRAF Gene Mutation Abnormality Present Outcome Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient has been screened for BRAF and has a V600 mutation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure BRAF Gene Mutation Abnormality Present Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory procedure testing for the presence of a mutation of the BRAF gene, a gene involved in cell organization/biogenesis and the inhibition of apoptosis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: BRAF Gene Mutation Abnormality Present Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in cell organization/biogenesis and the inhibition of apoptosis.:Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in cell organization/biogenesis and the inhibition of apoptosis.

Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

The non-affirmative response to a question.

A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient with unknown BRAF 600
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient with unknown BRAF 600X status: If patient has histologically confirmed melanoma, papillary thyroid, cholangiocarcinoma or testicular cancer that is metastatic or unresectable for which the investigator feels a BRAF 600X targeted agent is a reasonable treatment, has patient been screened by central BRAF testing and must demonstrate a V600 mutation prior to start of study agent?
